result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Deontey Burdine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Bail on deposit shall be applied.  Any remaining amount shall be returned to poster. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Deontey Burdine

records.addlTxt:
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3.5 YEARS with 239 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- Maintain employment.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
- Driver's license revoked for a period of 6 MONTHS. 
- Restitution set at $0.00. 


Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Bail on deposit shall be applied.  Any remaining amount shall be returned to poster.  

Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.  Firearms and voting warnings given.

Defendant Andrew Deontey Burdine appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Andrew Deontey Burdine.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Sentencing proceeded.

08:58 AM Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Andrew Deontey Burdine not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Andrew Deontey Burdine not in court, defendant in custody.  Amanda Kirklewski for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Attorney Hampton unable to appear. Case adjourned to schedule a new hearing.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Andrew Deontey Burdine not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 by Zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court via zoom, defendant Andrew Deontey Burdine not in court, in custody appearance waived.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held via zoom.  Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. The court order the matter adjourned back to Branch 2 via zoom.

  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Andrew Deontey Burdine in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton; both appear by video.  Defendant Andrew Deontey Burdine in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Andrew Deontey Burdine in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Andrew Deontey Burdine in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Andrew Deontey Burdine not in court.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.

22RM003708  Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
01/27/22.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/18/22 @ 1p
